main event: An orange to bright white sphere, approximately half the size of the moon, was observed burning out over Chicago on December 13, 1961.
interesting points: The object was visible for 4-5 seconds without any sound or signs of breaking up,The object changed color from orange to bright white,The sighting characteristics pointing to a meteor observation rather than an aircraft,The object followed a south to north course in a slight arc,The sighting was reported to the Air Technical Intelligence Center.
witness description: Base Operations Officer Thomas A. Hilgart
